channel.title: Mudclient 140 refactor
channel.description:
Hai all, I've been working on mudclient 140 for a few weeks now, and even making a server to go with it (from scratch, following the client's protocol). I thought I would share what I've done so far, at least with the client. I will upload the server at a later date, once I have a chance to at least get player updating completed.
Anyway, here is the repository to my project, I am going to attempt to document as much as I can about the client. inb4 "omg ur 'documenting' skills suck", yeah I know. I NEVER document my work, but I thought maybe someone can find it useful.
https://bitbucket.org/Hikilaka/mudclient-140

item.title: Mudclient 140 refactor
item.dc:creator: @S_v2 .S. v2
item.description:
@S_v2 wrote:

livingentity sounds weird. Besides, they aren’t living, they are sprites in a crummy virtual world.

Read full topic

item.title: Mudclient 140 refactor
item.dc:creator: @imthenull imthenull
item.description:
@imthenull wrote:

.S. v2:

Thanks for not always following Java’s conventions like a noob, but please use underscores.

Initially I did follow Java’s camelCase conventions, but later changed, It felt more fluent to me to use lowercase and to name them all one word.

.S. v2:

What’s wrong with Mob?

Nothing, what’s wrong with living entity?

.S. v2:

cache is for storing values from the Config archive, so why not call it Config?

I agree with you actually, I will change that once I get home.

.S. v2:

I call gamegraphics SpriteSurface (or SceneSurface), Surface from SDL_Surface, Sprite or Scene surface because it’s used to override the method for plotting sprites on the Scene.

Although that’s good reason to name it SpriteSurface, I would rather keep gamegraphics

.S. v2:

I can’t think of a better name for what you called socket than ByteBuffer, but it’s not entirely accurate. At any rate, socket is terrible. It’s used for config files among other things in earlier clients.

.S. v2:

camera is a scene, not just the camera.

.S. v2:

graphics -> surface, as mentioned before

.S. v2:

line/connection/networkedgame are fine, though scanline is more accurate.

.S. v2:

r is a polygon.

.S. v2:

in leaked code from Transformers Universe and Goldmine, what you called “game” is “gameshell”. But I prefer “Engine”, since the jagex engine isn’t limited to games.

.S. v2:

menu is not accurate. How about Panel?

.S. v2:

“gsmart” is not smart. Also, this: http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/desktop/ms738564(v=vs.85).aspx

.S. v2:

If you are going to remove deprecated shit, please specify the charset when using String.getBytes and use the java.awt.event; listeners.

I am eventually

I don’t feel like answering the rest, too lazy

Read full topic

item.title: Mudclient 140 refactor
item.dc:creator: @S_v2 .S. v2
item.description:
@S_v2 wrote:

Thanks for not always following Java’s conventions like a noob, but please use underscores.

What’s wrong with Mob?

cache is for storing values from the Config archive, so why not call it Config?

I call gamegraphics SpriteSurface (or SceneSurface), Surface from SDL_Surface, Sprite or Scene surface because it’s used to override the method for plotting sprites on the Scene.

I can’t think of a better name for what you called socket than ByteBuffer, but it’s not entirely accurate. At any rate, socket is terrible. It’s used for config files among other things in earlier clients.

camera is a scene, not just the camera.

graphics -> surface, as mentioned before

line/connection/networkedgame are fine, though scanline is more accurate.

r is a polygon.

in leaked code from Transformers Universe and Goldmine, what you called “game” is “gameshell”. But I prefer “Engine”, since the jagex engine isn’t limited to games.

menu is not accurate. How about Panel?

“gsmart” is not smart. Also, this: http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/desktop/ms738564(v=vs.85).aspx

If you are going to remove deprecated shit, please specify the charset when using String.getBytes and use the java.awt.event; listeners.

Read full topic
